intro: Podospermum roseum subsp. peristericum, commonly known as the silver leaf hibiscus, is a species native to Madagascar. It is a shrub characterized by its striking silver-white, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Its unique foliage and floral display make it a popular choice for horticultural enthusiasts.
